title.narrative: Stöd till HIPS - startegisk utvecklingsplan för 2015/2016
Support to the Heritage Institute for Policy Studies

description.narrative: SIDA support is aimed to strengthen the institute as an independent Somali-owned and Somali-managed think tank. The core support has been crucial in ensuring continued operation of HIPS as an independent policy institute. Hence, the support has strengthened HIPS institutional capacity, increased its research output, expanded its policy engagement as well as enabled it to augment and diversify its funding streams. HIPS five-year strategic plan objectives are:Strategic objective 1: To develop programs and conduct research in the priority thematic areas of peace, justice and good governance.Strategic objective 2: To foster inclusive public dialogues that will influence policy, increase transparency and accountability and inform HIPS research agenda.Strategic objective 3: To ensure sufficient staff in both numbers and capacity to deliver organizational objectives.Strategic objective 4: To fully computerize the core and support functions of HIPS activities.

The Heritage Institute for Policy Studies (HIPS) har ansökt om stöd från Sida på totalt MSEK 4 för genomförandet av sin strategiska plan "HIPS strategic development plan 2015-2016" i Somalia under perioden 1 oktober 2015 till 31 December 2016.
Insatsen syftar dels till att stärka institutet i sin roll som en nationell think tank och dess kapacitet att kunna påverka policybeslut genom att bland annat producera "policy briefs" baserat på dess tematiska forksknings- och påverkansprogram. Detta stöd inbegriper därför i) stärkandet av den institutionella strukturen, ii) stärkt kapacitet för resursmobilisering, iii) ökad personalkapacitet, iv) stärkt finansiell administrativ kapacitet. Insatsen syftar också till att stödja implementeringen av HIPS strategiska utvecklingsplan 2015 som inkluderar tematiska forsknings- och påverkansprogram . HIPS kommer även att genomföra en trendanalys av Sveriges stöd till Somalia.

The Heritage Institute for Policy Studies (HIPS) has applied to Sida for funding of 4 million SEK to carry out the ''HIPS strategic development plan 2015-2016'' in Somalia during the period 1 October 2015 to 31 December 2016.
The intervention aims at strengthening HIPS which is a national policy institute to be able to play their role more effectively as a think tank influencing policy decisions on Somalia by producing policy briefs from their thematic research programs and outreach and impact programs. Therefore the support aims at i) institutional structure strengthening, ii) increased capacity for resource mobilization, iii) increased human resource capacity, iv) increased financial administration capacity. The intervention also aims at supporting the implementation of the HIPS strategic development plan 2015 which includes thematic research programs and outreach and impact programs. The Research, Analysis and Development Evaluations (RAADE), with is a unit within HIPS will also conduct a trend analysis of Swedish support in Somalia.

description.narrative: The Heritage Institute of Policy Studies (HIPS) is Somalia's first think tank, established in 2013, provides policy makers with analyses and practical recommendations based on independent evidence-based research. Based on the HIPS Strategy (2018-2022), HIPS’ work revolves around two broad pillars – research action and policy action. In the research action, HIPS produces original research reports on strategicallyimportant issues for Somalia’s peace building, state building and institution building agenda. HIPS studies on AMISOM, higher education, federalism, the constitution, refugees, land issues, drought and the influences of external actors were well circulated among policy circles and had measurable impact on policy making in the country. Similarly, HIPS policy briefs have focused on the pertinent thorny issues and provided policy makers with analyses and practical recommendations. Briefings on how to end the Kismaayo and Gaalkacyo conflicts and studies on diaspora return, citizens’ priorities and perceptions, the political and civic engagement of Somali women, federalism and governance were all shared and deliberated in a bipartisan fashion. On the policy action, HIPS actively engages with Somalia’s policy and opinion makers, disseminates research findings and shares policy recommendations. Among other things, HIPS develops policy papers on issues that are central to the state-building process in Somalia with the aim of strengthening a Somali led Somali owned dialogue and discussion around central themes. HIPS also utilizes both traditional and social media to interface with its diverse audiences, ranging from ordinary Somalis inside Somalia and across the globe and to national policy makers and international actors working in or issues related to Somalia. HIPS’s flagship programme, Forum for Ideas, offers an interactive platform for Somalia’s policymakers, practitioners, business leaders, civil society, academia and activists. Both the roundtable discussions organized in Mogadishu and in the regional capitals and the Annual Forum for Ideas (AFI) attract citizens from across Somalia as well Somalis from the Horn of Africa and many in the diaspora. The forum previously held annually in Djibouti, was for the first time held in Somalia from 29 to 31 December 2020, with Puntland's hosting the event in Garowe. HIPS managed to convene most leading politicians in Somalia as an effort and opportunity to strengthen the dialogue between FGS and FMS leadership to reach consensus around how 2020/21 election will be conducted and breaking the existing political stalemate on elections. The parliamentary and presidential elections could not be held due to political disagreements between the FGS and FMS thus the forum facilitated talks and dialogue between the various parties. Several FMS leaders, most presidential candidates, former presidents, the Speakers of the upper and lower houses, the Deputy Prime Minister and substantial number of ministers attended the event. In the five years since its inception, HIPS has contributed to the transformation of the policy environment in Somalia. Sida has decided to sustain continued core support to HIPS for the period 2019-2022 for a second phase of the programme to enable HIPS to meet its desired objectives. Core funding allows HIPS to attract and retain local policy research talent, set their own research priorities and invest in policy outreach and communications to ensure that research results informs and influences important Somalia/national policy debates. In addition, the support to HIPS acts as a catalyst for positive change in supporting state-building and democratic governance structures in Somalia.
